title: What is necessary for ICT development? - Quora

response.answer_text: Information and communications technology (ICT) is an extensional term for information technology (IT) that stresses the role of unified communications[1] and the integration of telecommunications (telephone lines and wireless signals) and computers, as well as necessary enterprise software, middleware, storage, and audiovisual systems, that enable users to access, store, transmit, and manipulate information.[2] To unite Information technology and Communication Technology first and foremost is infrastructure. Throughout the world there should be enough infrastructures that includes, electricity, computer technology, hardware and telecommunication hardware's, software technology to combine IT with communication technology. The infrastructure should be present with the planners i.e. government and private entities, and also with the consumers i.e. citizens. Next comes the education. Unless a country is educated, we cannot imagine of implementing ICT and doing development from it. One should know how to use it and why to use it. This includes the involvement of both trainers and learner's. First they should know the basics. The basics here includes, computer education, hardware and software training, medium of communication to use the technology. Next is Planning. stating in an easy term, until and unless your country's government includes ICT in it's annual, short term, long term plans the mission vision of Development with ICT will be just a topic to gossip in the seminars. Proper planning should is necessary and the execution likewise. Else development of ICT and development with the use of ICT will take generations to achieve.
